name: Kepler-12
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-12 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-12 is a star with 1.17 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.48 times its radius. It is located 2949.75 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-12 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-12 system


Kepler-12 b

Kepler-12 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-12 b is 137.376 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-12 b is 19.661 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-12 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-12, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
